title: Apple joins Wireless Power Consortium ahead of next-gen iPhone launch
text:
Apple joins Wireless Power Consortium ahead of next-gen iPhone launch Apple joins Wireless Power Consortium ahead of next-gen iPhone launch By February 14, 2017 “Apple all but confirms that wireless charging is coming to next-gen iPhones” 
Several reports in the past have suggested that the iPhone 8 will come with wireless charging capabilities. Now the Cupertino tech giant has joined the Wireless Power Consortium, which has supercharged rumours that future iPhone users could live tangle-free. Image credit: Veniamin Geskin 
The Wireless Power Consortium is a group of 123 manufacturers that back the Qi wireless charging standard. Apple already uses a version of this in the Apple Watch. According to CNET , an Apple spokesperson said “the company is joining the Wireless Power Consortium to be able to participate and contribute ideas to the open, collaborative development of future wireless charging standards.” 
The news comes soon after a recent report claiming that the 2017 iPhones will support wireless charging. There are rumoured to be three iPhones this year – the iPhone 7s, iPhone 7s Plus and iPhone 8 / iPhone X, all featuring wireless charging.
